body.p: The Subscription page in allows organization administrators to view and manage their organization's subscription status, monitor license usage, and handle subscription-related actions. This page provides comprehensive information about the current subscription state and available actions based on the subscription type and status.

section.title: Accessing the Subscription Page
section.p: Only users with an Organization Administrator role can access the subscription management page. To access this page:

ol.li: Click on your user profile name in the top-right corner of the interface.
Select Manage organization from the drop-down menu.
In the organization management interface, click on Subscription in the left navigation panel.

section.note: If you do not see the Manage organization option in your user menu, you do not have administrator privileges for your organization.

section.title: Page Layout and Components
section.p: The subscription page is organized into two main sections:

dlentry.dd:
Displays the current subscription status, renewal information, and available management actions. This section includes:
Status indicator - A colored chip that shows the current trial/subscription state (Active, Expired, or Cancelled)
Status description - Detailed information about the subscription state and expiration/renewal date.
Action buttons (e.g. Manage subscription) - Context-sensitive buttons for managing the subscription.
Contact information - Direct link to sales support for additional assistance.

Shows the current allocation and usage of license seats for both Author and Subject-Matter Expert (SME) roles. This section includes:
Author seats - Progress bar and percentage that shows the used vs. total Author licenses.
SME seats - Progress bar and percentage that shows the used vs. total SME licenses.

section.note: The Seat Usage section is only displayed when the subscription is active and not expired.

section.title: Subscription Status Types
section.p: The subscription can be in one of several states, each with different visual indicators and available actions:

dlentry.dd:
Indicates that the organization is currently using a trial subscription. This status shows:
A yellow/orange status chip with warning icon.
The trial expiration date information.
A Buy Subscription button to upgrade to a paid plan.

Indicates that the trial period has ended. This status shows:
A red status chip indicating the trial has expired.
The expiration date information.
A Buy Subscription button to purchase a paid plan.
A Restart Trial button (if available) to extend the trial period.

Indicates an active paid subscription. This status shows:
A green status chip indicating an active status
The renewal date information
Manage Subscription button to access Verifone account management
Renew Plan button (if auto-renewal is disabled)
Stop Auto-renewal button (if auto-renewal is enabled)
Upgrade Plan button to increase the number of available seats

Indicates that the subscription has been cancelled. This status shows:
A red status chip indicating the subscription has been cancelled.
The cancellation information.
A Buy Subscription button to purchase a new subscription.

section.title: Purchase and Management Flow
section.p: The subscription management system provides different flows based on the current subscription state:

u.b: Upgrading from Trial to Paid Subscription

section.p: For organizations with active or expired trial subscriptions:

ol.li: Click the Buy Subscription button in the Subscription Status section.
You will be redirected to the Verifone payment system to complete the purchase.
After successful payment, your subscription status will automatically update to "Active".

section.p: For organizations with active paid subscriptions:

ol.li: Click the Manage Subscription button in the Subscription Status section.
The resulting dialog box provides instructions for accessing your Verifone account. It displays your order reference number with a copy button for easy access.
Click Go to Verifone Account to open the Verifone My Account page in a new window.

In Verifone, you can:
Update payment methods.
Enable or disable auto-renewal.
View billing history.

section.p: For paid subscriptions without auto-renewal enabled, you can manually renew your subscription:

ol.li: Click the Renew Plan button in the Subscription Status section.
A new browser tab will open and redirect you to the Verifone payment system.
Complete the renewal process through the Verifone checkout system using your preferred payment method.
After successful payment, you will be redirected to a confirmation page.
Close the renewal tab and return to the subscription page.
Wait up to 10 minutes for the system to process the renewal and update your subscription details.
Refresh the subscription page to see the updated expiration date.

section.note: The Renew Plan button is only available for paid subscriptions where auto-renewal was disabled during the original purchase. If you do not see this button, your subscription may have auto-renewal enabled or may not be eligible for manual renewal.

After completing the renewal process, allow up to 10 minutes for the Verifone platform to send the license change notification (LCN) event to . Your subscription expiration date will be updated automatically once this process is complete.
section.p: For active paid subscriptions with auto-renewal enabled, you can disable automatic renewal:

ol.li: Click the Stop Auto-renewal button in the Subscription Status section.
The system will immediately disable auto-renewal for your subscription.
The button will disappear and your subscription status will update to reflect that auto-renewal is disabled.
You will need to manually renew your subscription before the expiration date to continue using the service.

section.note: The Stop Auto-renewal button is only available for paid subscriptions purchased through the Verifone system where auto-renewal is currently enabled. Once disabled, you can re-enable auto-renewal through your Verifone account management interface.
When deleting the organization, if your organization has auto-renewal enabled, the system will automatically disable auto-renewal as part of the deletion process.
section.p: For active paid subscriptions, you can upgrade your plan to increase the number of available seats for both Author and SME roles:

ol.li: Click the Upgrade plan button in the Subscription Status section.
The Upgrade Subscription dialog box will open, showing your current seat allocation.

In the dialog box, specify the new number of seats for each role type:
Author Seats - Enter the desired number of Author licenses (must be equal to or greater than your current allocation).
SME Seats - Enter the desired number of SME licenses (must be equal to or greater than your current allocation).
Review the seat counts to ensure they meet your organization's needs.
Click Continue to proceed with the upgrade.
A new browser tab will open, redirecting you to the Verifone payment system to complete the upgrade purchase.
Complete the upgrade process through the Verifone checkout system using your preferred payment method.
After successful payment, you will be redirected to a confirmation page.
Close the upgrade tab and return to the subscription page.
Wait up to 10 minutes for the system to process the upgrade and update your subscription details.
Refresh the subscription page to see the updated seat allocation in the Seat Usage section.

section.note: The Upgrade plan button is only available for active paid subscriptions with Verifone account information. You cannot downgrade your subscription through this interface - upgrades can only increase the number of available seats.

After completing the upgrade process, allow up to 10 minutes for the Verifone platform to send the license change notification (LCN) event to . Your seat allocation will be updated automatically once this process is complete.

section.title: License Usage Monitoring
section.p: The Seat Usage section provides real-time monitoring of license consumption:

dlentry.dd:
Shows the usage of Content Fusion Author licenses, which are user-based. The display includes:
Number of active Author users out of total available.
Visual progress bar indicating usage percentage.
Percentage display for quick reference.

Shows the usage of Subject-Matter Expert licenses, which operate on a floating seat model. The display includes:
Number of active SME users out of total available.
Visual progress bar indicating usage percentage.
Percentage display for quick reference.

section.p:
License usage is calculated based on:
Active members - Users who are currently active in the organization.
Pending invitations - Users who have been invited but not yet accepted.
Platform role assignment - Whether users are assigned as Authors or SMEs.
section.note: Inactive users do not count against license limits, but their data remains intact and can be reactivated by an administrator.

section.title: Troubleshooting and Support
section.p: If you encounter issues with subscription management:

ul.li: Contact Sales - Use the contact information provided on the subscription page for direct assistance with subscription-related questions.
Organization Access - Ensure you have Organization Administrator privileges to access subscription management features.

Upgrade Issues - If the Upgrade plan button is not visible, verify that your subscription is active and paid. The upgrade feature is only available for paid subscriptions with Verifone account information.
Seat Validation - When upgrading, ensure that the new seat counts are equal to or greater than your current allocation. The system prevents downgrades through the upgrade interface.
Processing Delays - After completing an upgrade, allow up to 10 minutes for the system to process the changes. If seat allocation doesn't update after this time, refresh the page or contact support.
